metadata.title: CVE-2024-26818 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:tools/rtla: Fix clang warning about mount_point var size clang is reportingthis warning: $ make HOSTCC=clang CC=clang LLVM_IAS=1 [...] clang -O -g-DVERSION=\"6.8.0-rc3\" -flto=auto -fexceptions -fstack-protector-strong-fasynchronous-unwind-tables -fstack-clash-protection -Wall-Werror=format-security -Wp,-D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -Wp,-D_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS$(pkg-config --cflags libtracefs) -c -o src/utils.o src/utils.csrc/utils.c:548:66: warning: 'fscanf' may overflow; destination buffer inargument 3 has size 1024, but the corresponding specifier may require size1025 [-Wfortify-source] 548 | while (fscanf(fp, "%*s %" STR(MAX_PATH) "s%99s %*s %*d %*d\n", mount_point, type) == 2) { | ^ Increase mount_pointvariable size to MAX_PATH+1 to avoid the overflow.
